bars.name: Mary's Place
bars.description:
Mary's Place is the staging area and starting point on our journey. Few would have it any other way. Hosting our welcome picnic and boasting dirt cheap bottles, snacks, mural covered walls, a cozy "gaming" area, a picturesque beer garden, and the friendliest of staff, Mary's little slice of heaven is sure to leave you begging the timekeeper for a few extra minutes right out of the gate.

Activities: early bird bags, outdoor patio, meet and greet, jumbo jenga, hot dogs, t-shirt pickup, golden ticket raffle, group photo

bars.name: Filonek's
bars.description:
Recently renovated with large, garage style front windows Filonek's might surprise even the most veteran of crawlers. With boxed wines, arcade machines, Okocim by the barrel, outdoor seating, and a former Bartender of the Month, this neighborhood sleeper goes straight to the head of the class for those crawlers of Polish descent. You'll want to belly on up to the bar, as it's a preferred parking area for all those soaring with the white eagle.

Activities: pool, arcade style gaming, outdoor patio

bars.name: The Garage
bars.description:
The Garage opened in 2011 with a friendly welcome from the neighborhood. Patrons can enjoy some tasty apps and their deep beer selection. Their Vegas style rooftop deck seats 50. Who's pounding?

Activities: apps, multiple levels

bars.name: Jet's Public House
bars.description:
Formerly the site of Wally's, Jet's is a favorite with the neighborhood youngsters and offers up some decent pub grub. You'll want to hold your appetite for our next stop as our food there is paid for, however, must you indulge, try the tots. Grab a board game from the back and enjoy some good times with your friends. If you get the chance, I'd recommend a game of Taboo with Cheesy.

Activities: competitive board gaming, jukebox, sports on tv, darts

bars.name: The Three Counties Irish Pub
bars.description:
A fan favorite and host like no other. This authentic Irish gem not only pours a dynamite pint of the black stuff, but opens their loving arms to our annual H.O.Y.H.I.M.S.F.Y. jam and dance party. Eat some pizza, explore the beer garden, enjoy the show, and chat up the friendly staff about anything Irish. Top Notch. Formerly Snuggles Pub...oh man, if these walls could talk!

Activities: rock, H.O.Y.H.I.M.S.F.Y., outdoor patio, pizza, chalice presentation, dancing, craic
